body:
also on windows os
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/16518af6-f68b-4f38-9ddc-26fd33c01007)

```js
{
    "eol": "\r\n",
    "os_type": "windows",
    "platform": "windows",

```

```toml
[dependencies]
tauri = { version = "2.0.0-beta.24", features = [] }
tauri-plugin-shell = { version = "2.0.0-beta.9"}
tauri-plugin-os = { version = "2.0.0-beta.8" }
```
having the same issue after migration of the project from webpack to vite (project was previously migrated from v1 to v2, but had no issue with IPC, only after switching to vite IPC got down.
by removing "target" dir, "gen" dir, and stop using vite --force I was able to fix issue for myself

rename.from: [bug] [macos] [tauri v2] Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 (Bad Request) ipc://localhost/greet
rename.to: [bug] [macos] [windows] [tauri v2] Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 (Bad Request) ipc://localhost/greet

body:
Oh, we mixed it up with dygy's comments and thought it's resolved. But yes, please try again in the rc versions.

We still need to improve the errors somehow but `400` should typically mean that it's missing capability permissions or has missing command args.

It still happens in the latest releases. You guys can easily test it out by creating a new app with [create-tauri-app](https://v2.tauri.app/start/create-project/#using-create-tauri-app). It's easy to replicate. Both in macOS and Windows and possibly in Linux too.

@FabianLars Can you add the labels back and reopen the ticket?

What capability could be missing? This is the capabilities from the greet app.

{
  "$schema": "../gen/schemas/desktop-schema.json",
  "identifier": "default",
  "description": "Capability for the main window",
  "windows": ["main"],
  "permissions": [
    "core:path:default",
    "core:event:default",
    "core:window:default",
    "core:app:default",
    "core:image:default",
    "core:resources:default",
    "core:menu:default",
    "core:tray:default",
    "shell:allow-open"
  ]
}

Wait, i'm so sorry, i confused your issue with something else. I was looking for the issue where returning Errors is broken literally _everywhere_ and it was this one... Good thing i'll be on vacation the next few weeks, i'm really not on my game lately...

> Oh, we mixed it up with dygy's comments and thought it's resolved. But yes, please try again in the rc versions. > > We still need to improve the errors somehow but `400` should typically mean that it's missing capability permissions or has missing command args. i had it fixed for a few moments and now it's back. I tried to delete targets, creating new apps, creating new commands with different code, and other stuff, but it's not let me solve. I feel it could be some very very weird cache, but have zero understanding where I could clean it. Somehow once I was able, now I'm stuck on it again

the problem of this permission error that most errors like those says "you need to enable foo:bar-foo", this one contains "" instead of name. I tried to pass "" to permission lists but it didn't helped :D

@lucasfernog are you sure we have to close the issue now? it seems your work will help people see better error descriptions, however it does not mean that there is no more error on tauri side, we just need to log our errors
